meanings.definition: To crush or flatten with a steamroller.
meanings.sent1: The construction workers steamrolled the fresh asphalt to make the road smooth.
meanings.sent2: The steamroller steamrolled the pavement to create a level surface.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy tried to steamroll over the pile of leaves in the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her powerful voice steamrolled through the room, capturing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The giant steamroller steamrolled the tiny toy car effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: The team steamrolled their opponents in the championship game.
meanings.sent2: The dictator tried to steamroll over the protestors, but they stood their ground.
meanings.sent3: The little girl steamrolled her way to the front of the line to get the last ice cream cone.
meanings.sent4: The loud music steamrolled any chance of having a quiet conversation.
meanings.sent5: The storm steamrolled through the town, leaving destruction in its wake.

meanings.definition: To proceed with relentless force or speed.
meanings.sent1: The marathon runner steamrolled through the last mile to reach the finish line first.
meanings.sent2: The ambitious project manager steamrolled through the obstacles to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent3: The determined student steamrolled over the difficult math problems with ease.
meanings.sent4: The train steamrolled down the tracks, making good time on its journey.
meanings.sent5: The athlete steamrolled past the competition, securing a spot in the finals.
